alert.note: Alert for Camden; Dallas; Laclede; Miller; Morgan; Pulaski; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:11AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Webster, southeastern Dallas, northern Wright, Miller, Laclede, western Pulaski, eastern Camden and southeastern Morgan Counties through NOON CDT... At 1111 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Village of Four Seasons to 9 miles south of Camdenton to 6 miles northwest of Conway. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Fort Leonard Wood... Lebanon... Lake of The Ozarks... Lake of The Ozarks State Park... Ha Ha Tonka State Park... Bennett Spring State Park... Waynesville... Osage Beach... Camdenton... Village of Four Seasons... Richland... Lake Ozark... Morgan... Crocker... Laurie... Conway... Iberia... Sunrise Beach... Saint Elizabeth... St. Elizabeth... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 109 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for central, south central and southwestern Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Dallas; Laclede; Miller; Morgan; Pulaski; Webster; Wright
